sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using block matrices
message_1:
Consider the following system of linear equations:

\begin{align*}
    2x_1 + 3x_2 - 2x_3 &= 10 \\
    4x_1 + 5x_2 - 4x_3 &= 20 \\
    -2x_1 + 2x_2 + 3x_3 &= 5 \\
\end{align*}

Use block matrices to solve the system and find the values of $x_1$, $x_2$, and $x_3$.
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using block matrices, we first write the system in matrix form:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
    2 & 3 & -2 \\
    4 & 5 & -4 \\
    -2 & 2 & 3
\end{bmatrix}
\begin{bmatrix}
    x_1 \\
    x_2 \\
    x_3
\end{bmatrix}
=
\begin{bmatrix}
    10 \\
    20 \\
    5
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Now, we can use Gaussian elimination to find the reduced row echelon form (RREF) of the augmented matrix:

$$
\left[
\begin{array}{ccc|c}
    2 & 3 & -2 & 10 \\
    4 & 5 & -4 & 20 \\
    -2 & 2 & 3 & 5
\end{array}
\right]
$$

First, we'll divide the first row by 2 to get a leading 1:

$$
\left[
\begin{array}{ccc|c}
    1 & \frac{3}{2} & -1 & 5 \\
    4 & 5 & -4 & 20 \\
    -2 & 2 & 3 & 5
\end{array}
\right]
$$

Next, we'll eliminate the first column below the first row. We can do this by subtracting 4 times the first row from the second row and adding 2 times the first row to the third row:

$$
\left[
\begin{array}{ccc|c}
    1 & \frac{3}{2} & -1 & 5 \\
    0 & -1 & 0 & 0 \\
    0 & 5 & 1 & 15
\end{array}
\right]
$$

Now, we'll multiply the second row by -1 to get a leading 1:

$$
\left[
\begin{array}{ccc|c}
    1 & \frac{3}{2} & -1 & 5 \\
    0 & 1 & 0 & 0 \\
    0 & 5 & 1 & 15
\end{array}
\right]
$$

Next, we'll eliminate the second column below and above the second row. We can do this by subtracting $\frac{3}{2}$ times the second row from the first row and subtracting 5 times the second row from the third row:

$$
\left[
\begin{array}{ccc|c}
    1 & 0 & -1 & 5 \\
    0 & 1 & 0 & 0 \\
    0 & 0 & 1 & 15
\end{array}
\right]
$$

Finally, we'll eliminate the third column above the third row by adding the third row to the first row:

$$
\left[
\begin{array}{ccc|c}
    1 & 0 & 0 & 20 \\
    0 & 1 & 0 & 0 \\
    0 & 0 & 1 & 15
\end{array}
\right]
$$

Now, we can read off the solution from the RREF of the augmented matrix:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
    x_1 \\
    x_2 \\
    x_3
\end{bmatrix}
=
\begin{bmatrix}
    20 \\
    0 \\
    15
\end{bmatrix}
$$

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is $x_1 = 20$, $x_2 = 0$, and $x_3 = 15$.
